ast.name: yammer
ast.comment: Allows to create requests against the Facebook Graph APIs.

body.text: This library provides the building blocks to do Facebook Graph API requests (http://developers.facebook.com/docs/reference/apis/).
## Registering a Facebook app
Before you get started, you will need to create a Facebook app (if you have not done so). Start from here:
* https://developers.facebook.com/apps
Once you've created your Facebook app, expand the `Website with Facebook Login` tab and enter the following url:
* https://www.touchdevelop.com/[userid]/oauth
where `[userid]` should be replaced with your TouchDevelop user id. That is the funny word listed under your name in the hub (`/xyz`).
## Authentication
Grab your Facebook App ID (NOT the secret!) and pass it to the `authentication` action. Do not worry about leaking this id; it is designed to be public.
The second argument is the permission scope. For example, to post to the users wall, you will need the 'publish_stream' permission.
## Posting to the Facebool wall
A common Facebook activity is to post a message to your wall. This is done through the `post text`, `post message` or `post link` actions.
* posting a simple message
* posting a link
* posting a message
## Creating requests
You can use the `create request` action to craft more specialized requests against the Facebook Graph API.
The library will append the access token as needed; and will refresh the token if necessary.
Once you have the request object, you can set the additional parameters and send it away!
Authenticates the user with the given application.
Creates a Facebook Graph request with the given path and additional query arguments. Authenticates the user if needed. Returns invalid if authentication failed.
Posts a message to the current user Facebook wall and returns the ID of the generated message if successfull. Requires `publish_stream` scope.
Sends the Facebook Graph request and tries to handle gracefully errors.

thenBody.text: Most likely the oauth access token is expired

body.text: Posts the message on the current user Facebook wall and returns the ID of the generated message if successfull. Requires `publish_stream` scope.
Posts the message and the link on the current user Facebook wall and returns the ID of the generated message if successfull. Requires `publish_stream` scope.
